slidelink.displaytext: What You Need to Get Started

search.slidetext: quick start guide amazon home services
start start start start start start unit 4: live on amazon unit 3: account setup unit 2: account registration unit 1: get started course overview
unit three account setup

pre-packaged servicesthese services have a defined scope of work which allows customers to purchase based on price estimates. for offer-based jobs, pros enter their price estimates for each service they offer which customers can then view on amazon. these services can be identified on amazon by the orange stripe on the service image. custom services custom services do not have a defined scope of work and enable customers to request more complicated projects from pros. pros can then ask questions, view photos/videos and conduct on-site visits before providing the customer with a quote. these services can be identified on amazon by the green stripe on the service image.
select staff role select staff location select staff coverage
view your saved deposit method by clicking continue click add to input your bank account information
access add tax information from quick links complete the tax information interview
unit two account registration
select create a new account to create a new account for your business click continue to create your account and begin registration
unit four live on amazon

administrator | seller central and mobile app service technician | mobile service technicians will primarily use the mobile app to: view scheduled appointments collect signature to release customer payment submit technician photo verification complete change orders view new messages administrators will use both seller central and the mobile app to: claim jobs manage appointments assign technicians manage payments reports customer communication via buyer-seller messaging service

service technicians will primarily use the mobile app to: view scheduled appointments collect signature to release customer payment submit technician photo verification complete change orders view new messages administrators will use both seller central and the mobile app to: claim jobs manage appointments assign technicians manage payments reports customer communication via buyer-seller messaging service
unit one get started

names and email addresses of your staff addresses of your stores state/local business registration number valid credit card insurance information licenses the credit card information is used for identify verification. you will not receive any charges against this card. you are required to have general liability insurance, and you may also be required to have worker’s compensation insurance and/or automotive insurance, depending on your state and line of work.. make sure to have the id number and expiration date of your relevant licenses. if you have stores, you will want to input all of them so customers can find the location closest to them. do not add po boxes for store addresses. you will need to input all of your staff into seller central as well as process all in-home technicians through a background check. this is the registration or ubi number on your business license. it is not your ein or tax id number.
application approved account registration account setup live on amazon
seller central tasks mobile support mobile support new features seller central help contact seller support mobile setup payments evaluate this course

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: This course is designed for new service provider applicants who have been approved and are ready to register their Selling Services on Amazon account. Business Owners, or Administrative roles such as Office Managers, Schedulers, and Bookkeepers are the primary beneficiaries of this course. These roles will be power users with associated access and permissions in both Seller Central and the Selling Services on Amazon mobile app.

Before you get started, let’s take a quick tour so you are comfortable navigating the course content.

First, located at the top of the player is the Resources link. Here – you can download the Quick Start Guide document or elearning companion to add your notes and track your progress. Next to the resources link, is the Seller Central Help link – here you can quickly access your account and help articles if needed during the course.

At the top of the screen, you’ll find navigation bar with elements and call to action buttons like the mouse arrow or information icon. These navigation components are there for you to to access the inforamtion you need for featured topic and to prompt any releavant interactions.

Each core topic and related tasks are contained in units and are numbered to assist you with completing this progress in the necessary order.

When you’re ready to get started, click the start button to below.

The Quick Start course provides new users with foundation knowledge of how to be successful completing the registration process, setting up your business account and how to navigate Seller Central and the mobile app. You’ll learn how to complete the registration process, how to setup your new account, and how to build your business profile. Additionally, you’ll be introduced to Seller Central and the Selling Services on Amazon mobile app in preparation to begin receiving jobs. The course will be divided into five units: (1) Overview (2) Account Registration (3) Account Setup (4) Live on Amazon, and (5) Summary.
From the account activation page, enter the invitation code you received via email to activate your account.
create from email campaign
You’ll want to create a new account for your business.

Voiceover: Congratulations, your application has been approved! Now, you’ll need to activate and setup your account. Set aside around 45 minutes to complete the registration and setup steps. Before you get started, make sure you have these items on hand:

• Business Registration Number

• Valid credit card

• Insurance Information

• Names and Email Addresses of your staff members

• Addresses for your stores

• Relevant Licenses
From the homepage in Seller Central, you can access a list of the key registration and setup tasks to complete on your account and their status.
Before you get started, here’s an overview of the key steps to complete before you can go live on Amazon and begin receiving and fulfilling jobs.

add survey link

add to SC Support links – include screenshot in place of text featured
